alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 10:39PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM HST FRIDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 130 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 PM HST, radar showed heavy showers moving ashore from Kawaihae to Waikoloa Village, with peak rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waikoloa Village, Kapaau, Kawaihae, Kohala Ranch, Kamuela, Puako, Waimanu Valley, Pololu Valley, Waipio Valley, Halaula, Kukuihaele, Hawi, Mauna Lani, Waikoloa Beach and Mahukona. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 130 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
